revision.text: {{GA|21:39, 30 January 2015 (UTC)|topic=Art and architecture|page=1|oldid=644899888}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject National Register of Historic Places|class=GA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Public art|class=GA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject United States|class=GA|importance=Low|DC=Yes|DC-importance=Low}} {{WPMILHIST|class=GA|Memorials=yes|ACW=yes}} }} ==Comment== please do not redirect an article about a statue, not the subject of the statue. if you wish take it to Afd, be my guest. [[User:Slowking4|Slowking4]] ([[User talk:Slowking4|talk]]) 2:37 pm, 9 February 2011, Wednesday (3 years, 11 months, 16 days ago) (UTC−5) :Okay, maybe then put a redirect at the top for if you want the person and then one on that page for if you want to see the statue.[[User:Kamkek|Kamkek]] ([[User talk:Kamkek|talk]]) 2:40 pm, 9 February 2011, Wednesday (3 years, 11 months, 16 days ago) (UTC−5) ::done[[User:Slowking4|Slowking4]] ([[User talk:Slowking4|talk]]) 2:43 pm, 9 February 2011, Wednesday (3 years, 11 months, 16 days ago) (UTC−5) ==Possible sources== {{collapsetop|[[User:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''APK''']] [[User talk:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''whisper in my ear''']] 12:10, 24 January 2015 (UTC)}} * [http://pdfhost.focus.nps.gov/docs/NRHP/Text/78000257.pdf "National Register of Historic Places Inventory--Nomination Form - Civil War Monuments in Washington, D.C"], by Gary Scott, National Park Service, September 19, 1977 * [http://siris-artinventories.si.edu/ipac20/ipac.jsp?&profile=all&source=~!siartinventories&uri=full=3100001~!17855~!0#focus "Major General George B. McClellan, (sculpture)"], Smithsonian American Art Museum * [http://planning.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/op/publication/attachments/Inventory%202009%200%20Alpha%20Version%2003%2011.pdf "District of Columbia Inventory of Historic Sites"], District of Columbia Office of Planning - Historic Preservation Office, September 30, 2009 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1901-04-05/ed-1/seq-1/# "A M'clellan Statue"], ''Evening Star'', April 5, 1901 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1902-03-05/ed-1/seq-7/# "Models to be Shown"], ''Evening Star'', March 5, 1902 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn87062245/1902-06-01/ed-1/seq-34/# "Graceful Models for the McClellan Statue"], ''The Washington Times'', June 1, 1902 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1903-06-17/ed-1/seq-1/# "Were All Rejected"], ''Evening Star'', June 17, 1903 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1903-08-12/ed-1/seq-2/# "M'Monnies Selected"], ''Evening Star'', August 12, 1903 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1906-06-01/ed-1/seq-2/# "Citizens Suggest Site"], ''Evening Star'', June 1, 1906 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1906-06-17/ed-1/seq-7/# "Statue of McClellan"], ''Evening Star'', June 17, 1906 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1906-06-18/ed-1/seq-1/# "Site of McClellan Statue"], ''Evening Star'', June 18, 1906 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1907-05-01/ed-1/seq-3/# "An Army of Veterans"], ''Evening Star'', May 1, 1907 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1907-05-02/ed-1/seq-1/# "McClellan Statue Unveiling Today"], ''The Washington Herald'', May 2, 1907 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045462/1907-05-03/ed-1/seq-3/# "Bronze Statue of 'Little Mac'"], ''Evening Star'', May 3, 1907 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1907-05-02/ed-1/seq-3/# "Veterans Dedication McClellan Statue"], ''The Washington Herald'', May 3, 1907 * [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn82016187/1907-05-09/ed-1/seq-1/# "Maj. Gen. George B. McClellan"], ''The National Tribune'', May 9, 1907 * [http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/08/10/AR2009081002845.html "Neglected D.C. Statues Restored in Effort to Conserve Public Art"], by Michael E. Ruane, ''The Washington Post'', August 11, 2009 * [http://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/federal_government/preserving-and-restoring-our-nations-monuments/2014/04/14/0a1e0984-c41e-11e3-b574-f8748871856a_story.html "Preserving and restoring our nation’s monuments"], by Partnership for Public Servics, ''The Washington Post'', April 15, 2014 * "Testament to Union: Civil War Monuments in Washington, D.C.", by Kathryn Allamong Jacob, pgs, 130-134, JHU Press, Baltimore, 1998, ISBN 9780801858611 * "George B. McClellan and Civil War History: In the Shadow of Grant and Sherman", by Thomas J. Rowland, Kent State University Press, Kent, Ohio, 1998, ISBN 9780873386036 * "Kalorama Triangle: The History of a Capital Neighborhood", by Stephen A. Hansen, pgs. 125-127, The History Press, Charleston, 2011, ISBN 9781609494216 {{collapsebottom}} {{Talk:Major General George B. McClellan/GA1}} == Neighborhood category? == Is there a Washington, D.C. neighborhood or district category that could be added to this article? ---[[User:Another Believer|Another Believer]] ([[User talk:Another Believer|Talk]]) 03:15, 10 February 2015 (UTC) :I don't think so. There's a lot of pages that would be appropriate for a neighborhood category, but most people confuse [[Commons:Category:Sheridan-Kalorama|Sheridan-Kalorama]] and [[Commons:Category:Kalorama Triangle, Washington, D.C.|Kalorama Triangle]] and visa versa. (or they just say "Kalorama") [[User:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''APK''']] [[User talk:AgnosticPreachersKid|'''whisper in my ear''']] 04:29, 10 February 2015 (UTC)
